DataElement.preferredName: Skin Radiation Therapy Dose Greater Than 35 Gray Total Volume
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the volume of skin receiving more than 35 Gray (Gy) dose of radiation therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Skin Radiation Therapy Dose Greater Than 35 Gray Dose Volume
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::35_A SI derived unit of absorbed radiation dose. One gray is equal to an absorbed dose of one joule per kilogram of matter, or to 100 rads._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body.  It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::35:A SI derived unit of absorbed radiation dose. One gray is equal to an absorbed dose of one joule per kilogram of matter, or to 100 rads.:The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A SI derived unit of absorbed radiation dose. One gray is equal to an absorbed dose of one joule per kilogram of matter, or to 100 rads.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The number of the whole or complete volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The values that are permitted for the usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event. [Source: NCI]

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:Volume; the amount of 3-dimensional space occupied by an object.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center Radiation Dosimetry CRF in C3D.
